name: Global Health Challenges
description: A symposium jointly organized by the Fellowship of Rotarian Doctors and the Toronto Medical School. Open to all Medical Professionals.
gettingthere: Women's College Hospital - 76 Grenville St, Toronto, ON M5S 1B2
pricedetails: CAD including all fees and taxes

name: Rock at the Historic Distillery District
byline: A fun filled evening of food, entertainment and partying in Toronto’s Historic Distillery District.
description: The Distillery District is an inspired blend of Victorian Industrial architecture and stunning 21st century design and creativity. The result is an internationally acclaimed village of one-of-a-kind stores, shops, galleries, studios, restaurants, cafes, theatres and more. Join us for an evening of food, attractions, live country and rock music, and shopping at quaint shops. Create memories highlighting the architectural beauty of this 185 year old National Historic site!! Admission is all inclusive, with truly delicious food, attractions and entertainment. The Menu includes an array of delectable food….Archeo offers an Italian inspired menu, El Catrin delivers both traditional and modern Mexican cuisine, Pure Spirits Oyster House and Grill specializes in fresh fish and oysters,  Cluny Bistro and Boulangerie shares a wonderful world of French inspired food with a twist. There will be oysters, paella, poutine, tacos, s’mores, popcorn, cotton candy and more to feast upon, served from Market Huts set up in Trinity Square in the Distillery District. Live Country and Rock music will complete the warm summer evening while you eat, walk, talk, rest and shop or dance in the square!
gettingthere: A 20 minute walk or 10 minute TTC bus ride right to the front gate from the Toronto 2018 Venues.
pricedetails: CAD ($100 USD*) including all fees and taxes

venue.name: The Distillery District
venue.details: Nearly 20 years ago a small group of visionary developers had a dream for Toronto. They looked at a collection of Victorian Industrial buildings that had been pronounced a national historic site and imagined transforming it. But not just simply into another “historic district” or “pioneer village”, but into something exciting and unique. What you will find is the perfect fusion of old and new. An inspired blend of Victorian Industrial architecture and stunning 21st century design and creativity. The result is an internationally acclaimed village of stores, shops, galleries, studios, restaurants, cafes, theatres and more.

name: Jazz at the Aquarium
byline: A wondrous evening of Music, Food and Entertainment at Toronto’s renowned Ripley’s Aquarium.
description: Ripley’s Aquarium of Canada is a tropical reef with habitats of colourful coral, sea turtles, and sharks in a moonlight setting. Check out the awe inspiring exhibits: Canadian Waters Gallery, Rainbow Reef, Dangerous Lagoon, Discovery Centre, Ray Bay, Planet Jellies…and more! You are invited to a musical underwater adventure in the heart of downtown Toronto. Your selfies of sea creatures will come alive with a side of jazz, food and drinks. The live music of “Lady Be Good” Jazz Band featuring classical jazz, soulful RnB and modern pop will serenade you throughout the evening. All this complimented by a unique foodie menu designed to reflect the diversity of Toronto’s communities. Classic braised beef, complex Asian fare and unforgettable vegetarian curry with decadent desserts will impress your taste buds while the majesty of the Aquarium’s aquatic residents fill you with awe.
gettingthere: The aquarium is right beside the Metro Convention Center home of Toronto 2018.
pricedetails: CAD (approximately $100 USD*) including all fees and taxes.

venue.name: Ripley’s Aquarium of Canada
venue.details: Ripley’s Aquarium of Canada is the home of 16,000 aquatic animals and features North America’s longest underwater viewing tunnel with more than 5.7 million liters of water and over 100 interactive opportunities. This attraction in the heart of Toronto consists of nine curated galleries with saltwater and freshwater environments from around the world, including an exhibit of the Great Lakes basin.

name: Host Hospitality
byline: A fantastic evening of fellowship where you are hosted by local Rotarians.
description: Enjoy an evening of fun and fellowship as you are hosted by local Rotarians either in their own home or at a select venue. The evening will include a wonderful meal, something to drink and memories of a lifetime.
gettingthere: Your hosts will be arranging your transport to and from the Toronto 2018 Venues or your hotel.
pricedetails: CAD ($36 USD*) including all fees and taxes

name: ROTARYFEST
byline: The Toronto 2018 HOC invites you along with your Rotary family and friends to experience the diversity and multi culturalism of our host city at our ultimate ticketed event ROTARYFEST.
description:
Spectacular Fireworks
- Canadian Heritage Featured Events
 - Fantastic Entertainment and Music
 - Foods and treats from all around the world
 - Transportation to and from ROTARYFEST
 - A delicious meal (featuring Chicken & Ribs, Halal Chicken and Vegetarian Selections and much more)
 - A complimentary soft drink, beer or wine
 - An experience of a lifetime.

Come and have fun with us. Let’s congratulate our Rotary President, Ian Riseley and his terrific wife Juliet on one of the best Rotary Years ever.
gettingthere: ROTARYFEST is being held at the Canadian National Exhibition Centre. One GO Train Station west of the Toronto 2018 venues.
pricedetails: CAD (approximately ($75 USD*) including all fees and taxes.

venue.name: Exhibition Place
venue.details: Exhibition Place is a leading destination for trade and consumer shows, meetings, conferences, conventions and community space. Attracting more then 5.5 million visitors a year we offer convention, exhibition and conference venues, sporting facilities, restaurants, nightclubs, and attractions in a beautiful 192 acre parkland.
